summary.long: Mark is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: This is the beginning of the Good News about Yeshua Christ, the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prophet Isaiah wrote,
“I am sending my messenger ahead of you
    to prepare the way for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A voice cries out in the desert:
    ‘Prepare the way for the Lord!
    Make his paths straight!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John the Baptizer was in the desert telling people about a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Judea and all the people of Jerusalem went to him. As they confessed their sins, he baptized them in the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was dressed in clothes made from camel’s hair. He wore a leather belt around his waist and ate locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He announced, “The one who comes after me is more powerful than I. I am not worthy to bend down and untie his sandal straps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Yeshua came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Yeshua came out of the water, he saw heaven split open and the Spirit coming down to him as a dove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice from heaven said, “You are my Son, whom I love. I am pleased with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the Spirit brought him into the desert,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where he was tempted by Satan for 40 days. He was there with the wild animals, and the angels took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After John had been put in prison, Yeshua went to Galilee and told people the Good News of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The time has come, and the kingdom of God is near. Change the way you think and act, and believe the Good News.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As he was going along the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew. They were throwing a net into the sea because they were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “Come, follow me! I will teach you how to catch people instead of fish.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They immediately left their nets and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Yeshua went on a little farther, he saw James and John, the sons of Zebedee. They were in a boat preparing their nets to go fishing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He immediately called them, and they left their father Zebedee and the hired men in the boat and followed Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went to Capernaum. On the next day of worship, Yeshua went into the synagogue and began to teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were amazed at his teachings. Unlike their experts in Moses’ Teachings, he taught them with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time there was a man in the synagogue who was controlled by an evil spirit. He shouted,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you want with us, Yeshua from Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua ordered the spirit, “Keep quiet, and come out of him!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The evil spirit threw the man into convulsions and came out of him with a loud shriek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone was stunned. They said to each other, “What is this? This is a new teaching that has authority behind it! He gives orders to evil spirits, and they obey him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about him spread quickly throughout the surrounding region of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they left the synagogue, they went directly to the house of Simon and Andrew. James and John went with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon’s mother-in-law was in bed with a fever. The first thing they did was to tell Yeshua about her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua went to her, took her hand, and helped her get up. The fever went away, and she prepared a meal for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the evening, when the sun had set, people brought to him everyone who was sick and those possessed by demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole city had gathered at his door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cured many who were sick with various diseases and forced many demons out of people. However, he would not allow the demons to speak. After all, they knew who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, long before sunrise, Yeshua went to a place where he could be alone to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon and his friends searched for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they found him, they told him, “Everyone is looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “Let’s go somewhere else, to the small towns that are nearby. I have to spread the Good News in them also. This is why I have come.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So he went to spread the Good News in the synagogues all over Galilee, and he forced demons out of people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a man with a serious skin disease came to him. The man fell to his knees and begged Yeshua, “If you’re willing, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua felt sorry for him, reached out, touched him, and said, “I’m willing. So be clean!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Immediately, his skin disease went away, and he was clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua sent him away at once and warned him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t tell anyone about this! Instead, show yourself to the priest. Then offer the sacrifices which Moses commanded as proof to people that you are clean.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the man left, he began to talk freely. He spread his story so widely that Yeshua could no longer enter any city openly. Instead, he stayed in places where he could be alone. But people still kept coming to him from everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Several days later Yeshua came back to Capernaum. The report went out that he was home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people had gathered. There was no room left, even in front of the door. Yeshua was speaking God’s word to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Four men came to him carrying a paralyzed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since they could not bring him to Yeshua because of the crowd, they made an opening in the roof over the place where Yeshua was. Then they lowered the cot on which the paralyzed man was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua saw their faith, he said to the man, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Some experts in Moses’ Teachings were sitting there. They thought,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why does he talk this way? He’s dishonoring God. Who besides God can forgive sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once, Yeshua knew inwardly what they were thinking. He asked them, “Why do you have these thoughts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Is it easier to say to this paralyzed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, pick up your cot, and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” Then he said to the paralyzed man,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “I’m telling you to get up, pick up your cot, and go home!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The man got up, immediately picked up his cot, and walked away while everyone watched. Everyone was amazed and praised God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua went to the seashore again. Large crowds came to him, and he taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua was leaving, he saw Levi, son of Alphaeus, sitting in a tax office. Yeshua said to him, “Follow me!” So Levi got up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Later Yeshua was having dinner at Levi’s house. Many tax collectors and sinners who were followers of Yeshua were eating with him and his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the experts in Moses’ Teachings who were Pharisees saw him eating with sinners and tax collectors, they asked his disciples, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua heard that, he said to them, “Healthy people don’t need a doctor; those who are sick do. I’ve come to call sinners, not people who think they have God’s approval.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. Some people came to Yeshua and said to him, “Why do John’s disciples and the Pharisees’ disciples fast, but your disciples don’t?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied, “Can wedding guests fast while the groom is still with them? As long as they have the groom with them, they cannot fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the time will come when the groom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one patches an old coat with a new piece of cloth that will shrink. Otherwise, the new patch will shrink and rip away some of the old cloth, and the tear will become worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People don’t pour new wine into old wineskins. If they do, the wine will make the skins burst, and both the wine and the skins will be ruined. Rather, new wine is to be poured into fresh skins.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Once on a day of worship Yeshua was going through the grainfields. As the disciples walked along, they began to pick the heads of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees asked him, “Look! Why are your disciples doing something that is not permitted on the day of worship?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua asked them, “Haven’t you ever read what David did when he and his men were in need and were hungry?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Haven’t you ever read how he went into the house of God when Abiathar was chief priest and ate the bread of the presence? He had no right to eat those loaves. Only the priests have that right. Haven’t you ever read how he also gave some of it to his men?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he added, “The day of worship was made for people, not people for the day of worship.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For this reason the Son of Man has authority over the day of worship.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Yeshua went into a synagogue again. A man who had a paralyzed hand was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were watching Yeshua closely. They wanted to see whether he would heal the man on the day of worship so that they could accuse him of doing something wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told the man with the paralyzed hand, “Stand in the center of the synagogue.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he asked them, “Is it right to do good or to do evil on the day of worship, to give a person back his health or to let him die?”
But they were silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua was angry as he looked around at them. He was deeply hurt because their minds were closed. Then he told the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held it out, and his hand became normal again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees left, and with Herod’s followers they immediately plotted to kill Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua left with his disciples for the Sea of Galilee. A large crowd from Galilee, Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem, Idumea, and from across the Jordan River, and from around Tyre and Sidon followed him. They came to him because they had heard about everything he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told his disciples to have a boat ready so that the crowd would not crush him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had cured so many that everyone with a disease rushed up to him in order to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever people with evil spirits saw him, they would fall down in front of him and shout, “You are the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave them orders not to tell people who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua went up a mountain, called those whom he wanted, and they came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed twelve whom he called apostles. They were to accompany him and to be sent out by him to spread the Good News.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also had the authority to force demons out of people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed these twelve: Simon (whom Yeshua named Peter),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and his brother John (Zebedee’s sons whom Yeshua named Boanerges, which means “Thunderbolts”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James (son of Alphaeus), Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas Iscariot (who later betrayed Yeshua).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua went home. Another crowd gathered so that Yeshua and his disciples could not even eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his family heard about it, they went to get him. They said, “He’s out of his mind!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The experts in Moses’ Teachings who had come from Jerusalem said, “Beelzebul is in him,” and “He forces demons out of people with the help of the ruler of demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua called them together and used this illustration: “How can Satan force out Satan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a household is divided against itself, that household will not last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if Satan rebels against himself and is divided, he cannot last. That will be the end of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one can go into a strong man’s house and steal his property. First he must tie up the strong man. Then he can go through the strong man’s house and steal his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee this truth: People will be forgiven for any sin or curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever curses the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven. He is guilty of an everlasting sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said this because the experts in Moses’ Teachings had said that he had an evil spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his mother and his brothers arrived. They stood outside and sent someone to ask him to come out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd sitting around Yeshua told him, “Your mother and your brothers are outside looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied to them, “Who is my mother, and who are my brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then looking at those who sat in a circle around him, he said, “Look, here are my mother and my brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does what God wants is my brother and sister and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua began to teach again by the Sea of Galilee. A very large crowd gathered around him, so he got into a boat and sat in it. The boat was in the water while the entire crowd lined the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He used stories as illustrations to teach them many things.
While he was teaching them, he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen! A farmer went to plant seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some seeds were planted along the road, and birds came and devoured them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seeds were planted on rocky ground, where there wasn’t much soil. The plants sprouted quickly because the soil wasn’t deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun came up, they were scorched. They didn’t have any roots, so they withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seeds were planted among thornbushes. The thornbushes grew up and choked them, and they didn’t produce anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But other seeds were planted on good ground, sprouted, and produced thirty, sixty, or one hundred times as much as was planted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He added, “Let the person who has ears listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was alone with his followers and the twelve apostles, they asked him about the stories.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied to them, “The mystery about the kingdom of God has been given directly to you. To those on the outside, it is given in stories:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘They see clearly but don’t perceive.
    They hear clearly but don’t understand.
    They never return to me
    and are never forgiven.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua asked them, “Don’t you understand this story? How, then, will you understand any of the stories I use as illustrations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The farmer plants the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people are like seeds that were planted along the road. Whenever they hear the word, Satan comes at once and takes away the word that was planted in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other people are like seeds that were planted on rocky ground. Whenever they hear the word, they accept it at once with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they don’t develop any roots. They last for a short time. When suffering or persecution comes along because of the word, they immediately fall from faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other people are like seeds planted among thornbushes. They hear the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the worries of life, the deceitful pleasures of riches, and the desires for other things take over. They choke the word so that it can’t produce anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others are like seeds planted on good ground. They hear the word, accept it, and produce crops—thirty, sixty, or one hundred times as much as was planted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “Does anyone bring a lamp into a room to put it under a basket or under a bed? Isn’t it put on a lamp stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is nothing hidden that will not be revealed. There is nothing kept secret that will not come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the person who has ears listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went on to say, “Pay attention to what you’re listening to! Knowledge will be measured out to you by the measure of attention you give. This is the way knowledge increases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who understand these mysteries will be given more knowledge. However, some people don’t understand these mysteries. Even what they understand will be taken away from them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said, “The kingdom of God is like a man who scatters seeds on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sleeps at night and is awake during the day. The seeds sprout and grow, although the man doesn’t know how.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ground produces grain by itself. First the green blade appears, then the head, then the head full of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the grain is ready, he cuts it with a sickle, because harvest time has come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua asked, “How can we show what the kingdom of God is like? To what can we compare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s like a mustard seed planted in the ground. The mustard seed is one of the smallest seeds on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, when planted, it comes up and becomes taller than all the garden plants. It grows such large branches that birds can nest in its shade.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua spoke God’s word to them using many illustrations like these. In this way people could understand what he taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not speak to them without using an illustration. But when he was alone with his disciples, he explained everything to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That evening, Yeshua said to his disciples, “Let’s cross to the other side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leaving the crowd, they took Yeshua along in a boat just as he was. Other boats were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A violent windstorm came up. The waves were breaking into the boat so that it was quickly filling up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he was sleeping on a cushion in the back of the boat.
So they woke him up and said to him, “Teacher, don’t you care that we’re going to die?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he got up, ordered the wind to stop, and said to the sea, “Be still, absolutely still!” The wind stopped blowing, and the sea became very calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Why are you such cowards? Don’t you have any faith yet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were overcome with fear and asked each other, “Who is this man? Even the wind and the sea obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They arrived in the territory of the Gerasenes on the other side of the Sea of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Yeshua stepped out of the boat, a man came out of the tombs and met him. The man was controlled by an evil spirit
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lived among the tombs. No one could restrain him any longer, not even with a chain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had often been chained hand and foot. However, he snapped the chains off his hands and broke the chains from his feet. No one could control him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Night and day he was among the tombs and on the mountainsides screaming and cutting himself with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man saw Yeshua at a distance. So he ran to Yeshua, bowed down in front of him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shouted, “Why are you bothering me now, Yeshua, Son of the Most High God? Swear to God that you won’t torture me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shouted this because Yeshua said, “You evil spirit, come out of the man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked him, “What is your name?”
He told Yeshua, “My name is Legion [Six Thousand], because there are many of us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He begged Yeshua not to send them out of the territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large herd of pigs was feeding on a mountainside nearby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons begged him, “Send us into the pigs! Let us enter them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua let them do this. The evil spirits came out of the man and went into the pigs. The herd of about two thousand pigs rushed down the cliff into the sea and drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who took care of the pigs ran away. In the city and countryside they reported everything that had happened. So the people came to see what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Yeshua and saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons. The man was sitting there dressed and in his right mind. The people were frightened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who saw this told what had happened to the demon-possessed man and the pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people began to beg Yeshua to leave their territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Yeshua stepped into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed begged him, “Let me stay with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yeshua would not allow it. Instead, he told the man, “Go home to your family, and tell them how much the Lord has done for you and how merciful he has been to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man left. He began to tell how much Yeshua had done for him in the Ten Cities. Everyone was amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua again crossed to the other side of the Sea of Galilee in a boat. A large crowd gathered around him by the seashore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A synagogue leader named Jairus also arrived. When he saw Yeshua, he quickly bowed down in front of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He begged Yeshua, “My little daughter is dying. Come, lay your hands on her so that she may get well and live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua went with the man. A huge crowd followed Yeshua and pressed him on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the crowd was a woman who had been suffering from chronic bleeding for twelve years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although she had been under the care of many doctors and had spent all her money, she had not been helped at all. Actually, she had become worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since she had heard about Yeshua, she came from behind in the crowd and touched his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “If I can just touch his clothes, I’ll get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her bleeding stopped immediately. She felt cured from her illness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that moment Yeshua felt power had gone out of him. He turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said to him, “How can you ask, ‘Who touched me,’ when you see the crowd pressing you on all sides?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he kept looking around to see the woman who had done this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman trembled with fear. She knew what had happened to her. So she quickly bowed in front of him and told him the whole truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace! Be cured from your illness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Yeshua was still speaking to her, some people came from the synagogue leader’s home. They told the synagogue leader, “Your daughter has died. Why bother the teacher anymore?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua overheard what they said, he told the synagogue leader, “Don’t be afraid! Just believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua allowed no one to go with him except Peter and the two brothers James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the home of the synagogue leader, Yeshua saw a noisy crowd there. People were crying and sobbing loudly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came into the house, he asked them, “Why are you making so much noise and crying? The child isn’t dead. She’s just sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laughed at him. So he made all of them go outside. Then he took the child’s father, mother, and his three disciples and went to the child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua took the child’s hand and said to her, “Talitha, koum!” which means, “Little girl, I’m telling you to get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The girl got up at once and started to walk. (She was twelve years old.) They were astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua ordered them not to let anyone know about this. He also told them to give the little girl something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua left that place and went to his hometown. His disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the day of worship came, he began to teach in the synagogue. He amazed many who heard him. They asked, “Where did this man get these ideas? Who gave him this kind of wisdom and the ability to do such great miracles?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isn’t this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and the brother of James, Joseph, Judas, and Simon? Aren’t his sisters here with us?” So they took offense at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yeshua told them, “The only place a prophet isn’t honored is in his hometown, among his relatives, and in his own house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He couldn’t work any miracles there except to lay his hands on a few sick people and cure them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their unbelief amazed him.
Then Yeshua went around to the villages and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called the twelve apostles, sent them out two by two, and gave them authority over evil spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He instructed them to take nothing along on the trip except a walking stick. They were not to take any food, a traveling bag, or money in their pockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They could wear sandals but could not take along a change of clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Whenever you go into a home, stay there until you’re ready to leave that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever people don’t welcome you or listen to you, leave and shake the dust from your feet as a warning to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the apostles went and told people that they should turn to God and change the way they think and act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also forced many demons out of people and poured oil on many who were sick to cure them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Herod heard about Yeshua, because Yeshua’s name had become well-known. Some people were saying, “John the Baptizer has come back to life. That’s why he has the power to perform these miracles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “He is Elijah.” Still others said, “He is a prophet like one of the other prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod heard about it, he said, “I had John’s head cut off, and he has come back to life!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod had sent men who had arrested John, tied him up, and put him in prison. Herod did that for Herodias, whom he had married. (She used to be his brother Philip’s wife.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John had been telling Herod, “It’s not right for you to be married to your brother’s wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herodias held a grudge against John and wanted to kill him. But she wasn’t allowed to do it
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Herod was afraid of John. Herod knew that John was a fair and holy man, so he protected him. When he listened to John, he would become very disturbed, and yet he liked to listen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An opportunity finally came on Herod’s birthday. Herod gave a dinner for his top officials, army officers, and the most important people of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His daughter, that is, Herodias’ daughter, came in and danced. Herod and his guests were delighted with her. The king told the girl, “Ask me for anything you want, and I’ll give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He swore an oath to her: “I’ll give you anything you ask for, up to half of my kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So she went out and asked her mother, “What should I ask for?”
Her mother said, “Ask for the head of John the Baptizer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the girl hurried back to the king with her request. She said, “I want you to give me the head of John the Baptizer on a platter at once.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king deeply regretted his promise. But because of his oath and his guests, he didn’t want to refuse her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, the king sent a guard and ordered him to bring John’s head. The guard cut off John’s head in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought the head on a platter and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John’s disciples heard about this, they came for his body and laid it in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles gathered around Yeshua. They reported to him everything they had done and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “Let’s go to a place where we can be alone to rest for a while.” Many people were coming and going, and Yeshua and the apostles didn’t even have a chance to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went away in a boat to a place where they could be alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many people saw them leave and recognized them. The people ran from all the cities and arrived ahead of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua got out of the boat, he saw a large crowd and felt sorry for them. They were like sheep without a shepherd. So he spent a lot of time teaching them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was late, his disciples came to him. They said, “No one lives around here, and it’s already late.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send the people to the closest farms and villages to buy themselves something to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua replied, “You give them something to eat.”
They said to him, “Should we go and spend about a year’s wages on bread to feed them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go and see.”
When they found out, they told him, “Five loaves of bread and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he ordered all of them to sit down in groups on the green grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sat down in groups of hundreds and fifties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he took the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and blessed the food. He broke the loaves apart and kept giving them to the disciples to give to the people. He also gave pieces of the two fish to everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them ate as much as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they picked up the leftover pieces, they filled twelve baskets with bread and fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 5,000 men who had eaten the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua quickly made his disciples get into a boat and cross to Bethsaida ahead of him while he sent the people away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying goodbye to them, he went up a mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, the boat was in the middle of the sea, and he was alone on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua saw that they were in a lot of trouble as they rowed, because they were going against the wind. Between three and six o’clock in the morning, he came to them. He was walking on the sea. He wanted to pass by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw him walking on the sea, they thought, “It’s a ghost!” and they began to scream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All of them saw him and were terrified.
Immediately, he said, “Calm down! It’s me. Don’t be afraid!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He got into the boat with them, and the wind stopped blowing. The disciples were astounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (They didn’t understand what had happened with the loaves of bread. Instead, their minds were closed.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They crossed the sea, came to shore at Gennesaret, and anchored there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as they stepped out of the boat, the people recognized Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ran all over the countryside and began to carry the sick on cots to any place where they heard he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever he would go into villages, cities, or farms, people would put their sick in the marketplaces. They begged him to let them touch the edge of his clothes. Everyone who touched his clothes was made well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and some experts in Moses’ Teachings who had come from Jerusalem gathered around Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They saw that some of his disciples were unclean because they ate without washing their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Pharisees, like all other Jewish people, don’t eat unless they have properly washed their hands. They follow the traditions of their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they come from the marketplace, they don’t eat unless they have washed first. They have been taught to follow many other rules. For example, they must also wash their cups, jars, brass pots, and dinner tables.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and the experts in Moses’ Teachings asked Yeshua, “Why don’t your disciples follow the traditions taught by our ancestors? They are unclean because they don’t wash their hands before they eat!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua told them, “Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites in Scripture:
‘These people honor me with their lips,
    but their hearts are far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their worship of me is pointless,
    because their teachings are rules made by humans.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You abandon the commandments of God to follow human traditions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He added, “You have no trouble rejecting the commandments of God in order to keep your own traditions!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For example, Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother’ and ‘Whoever curses father or mother must be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say, ‘If a person tells his father or mother that whatever he might have used to help them is corban (that is, an offering to God),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he no longer has to do anything for his father or mother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of your traditions you have destroyed the authority of God’s word. And you do many other things like that.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called the crowd again and said to them, “Listen to me, all of you, and try to understand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing that goes into a person from the outside can make him unclean. It’s what comes out of a person that makes him unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the person who has ears listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had left the people and gone home, his disciples asked him about this illustration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “Don’t you understand? Don’t you know that whatever goes into a person from the outside can’t make him unclean?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It doesn’t go into his thoughts but into his stomach and then into a toilet.” (By saying this, Yeshua declared all foods acceptable.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He continued, “It’s what comes out of a person that makes him unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Evil thoughts, sexual sins, stealing, murder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: adultery, greed, wickedness, cheating, shameless lust, envy, cursing, arrogance, and foolishness come from within a person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these evils come from within and make a person unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua left that place and went to the territory of Tyre. He didn’t want anyone to know that he was staying in a house there. However, it couldn’t be kept a secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman whose little daughter had an evil spirit heard about Yeshua. She went to him and bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman happened to be Greek, born in Phoenicia in Syria. She asked him to force the demon out of her daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to her, “First, let the children eat all they want. It’s not right to take the children’s food and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She answered him, “Lord, even the dogs under the table eat some of the children’s scraps.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to her, “Because you have said this, go! The demon has left your daughter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman went home and found the little child lying on her bed, and the demon was gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua then left the neighborhood of Tyre. He went through Sidon and the territory of the Ten Cities to the Sea of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people brought to him a man who was deaf and who also had a speech defect. They begged Yeshua to lay his hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua took him away from the crowd to be alone with him. He put his fingers into the man’s ears, and after spitting, he touched the man’s tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he looked up to heaven, sighed, and said to the man, “Ephphatha!” which means, “Be opened!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the man could hear and talk normally.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua ordered the people not to tell anyone. But the more he ordered them, the more they spread the news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua completely amazed the people. They said, “He has done everything well. He makes the deaf hear and the mute talk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About that time there was once again a large crowd with nothing to eat. Yeshua called his disciples and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I feel sorry for the people. They have been with me three days now and have nothing to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I send them home before they’ve eaten, they will become exhausted on the road. Some of them have come a long distance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples asked him, “Where could anyone get enough bread to feed these people in this place where no one lives?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked them, “How many loaves of bread do you have?”
They answered, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ordered the crowd to sit down on the ground. He took the seven loaves and gave thanks to God. Then he broke the bread and gave it to his disciples to serve to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also had a few small fish. He blessed them and said that the fish should also be served to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people ate as much as they wanted. The disciples picked up the leftover pieces and filled seven large baskets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About four thousand people were there. Then he sent the people on their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, Yeshua and his disciples got into a boat and went into the region of Dalmanutha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees went to Yeshua and began to argue with him. They tested him by demanding that he perform a miraculous sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With a deep sigh he asked, “Why do these people demand a sign? I can guarantee this truth: If these people are given a sign, it will be far different than what they want!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he left them there.
He got into a boat again and crossed to the other side of the Sea of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples had forgotten to take any bread along and had only one loaf with them in the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua warned them, “Be careful! Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had been discussing with one another that they didn’t have any bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua knew what they were saying and asked them, “Why are you discussing the fact that you don’t have any bread? Don’t you understand yet? Don’t you catch on? Are your minds closed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you blind and deaf? Don’t you remember?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets did you fill with leftover pieces?”
They told him, “Twelve.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many large baskets did you fill with leftover pieces?”
They answered him, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Don’t you catch on yet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they came to Bethsaida, some people brought a blind man to Yeshua. They begged Yeshua to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua took the blind man’s hand and led him out of the village. He spit into the man’s eyes and placed his hands on him. Yeshua asked him, “Can you see anything?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man looked up and said, “I see people. They look like trees walking around.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua placed his hands on the man’s eyes a second time, and the man saw clearly. His sight was normal again. He could see everything clearly even at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told him when he sent him home, “Don’t go into the village.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua and his disciples went to the villages around Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples, “Who do people say I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, “Some say you are John the Baptizer, others Elijah, still others one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “But who do you say I am?”
Peter answered him, “You are the Messiah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ordered them not to tell anyone about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to teach them that the Son of Man would have to suffer a lot. He taught them that he would be rejected by the leaders, the chief priests, and the experts in Moses’ Teachings. He would be killed, but after three days he would come back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He told them very clearly what he meant.
Peter took him aside and objected to this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua turned, looked at his disciples, and objected to what Peter said. Yeshua said, “Get out of my way, Satan! You aren’t thinking the way God thinks but the way humans think.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua called the crowd to himself along with his disciples. He said to them, “Those who want to follow me must say no to the things they want, pick up their crosses, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who want to save their lives will lose them. But those who lose their lives for me and for the Good News will save them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What good does it do for people to win the whole world yet lose their lives?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what should a person give in exchange for life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If people are ashamed of me and what I say in this unfaithful and sinful generation, the Son of Man will be ashamed of those people when he comes with the holy angels in his Father’s glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “I can guarantee this truth: Some people who are standing here will not die until they see the kingdom of God arrive with power.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After six days Yeshua took only Peter, James, and John and led them up a high mountain where they could be alone.
Yeshua’s appearance changed in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His clothes became dazzling white, whiter than anyone on earth could bleach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elijah and Moses appeared to them and were talking with Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Yeshua, “Rabbi, it’s good that we’re here. Let’s put up three tents—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Peter didn’t know how to respond. He and the others were terrified.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a cloud overshadowed them. A voice came out of the cloud and said, “This is my Son, whom I love. Listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, as they looked around, they saw no one with them but Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On their way down the mountain, Yeshua ordered them not to tell anyone what they had seen. They were to wait until the Son of Man had come back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept in mind what he said but argued among themselves what he meant by “come back to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked him, “Don’t the experts in Moses’ Teachings say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “Elijah is coming first and will put everything in order again. But in what sense was it written that the Son of Man must suffer a lot and be treated shamefully?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, I can guarantee that Elijah has come. Yet, people treated him as they pleased, as Scripture says about him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the other disciples, they saw a large crowd around them. Some experts in Moses’ Teachings were arguing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people were very surprised to see Yeshua and ran to welcome him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua asked the experts in Moses’ Teachings, “What are you arguing about with them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man in the crowd answered, “Teacher, I brought you my son. He is possessed by a spirit that won’t let him talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the spirit brings on a seizure, it throws him to the ground. Then he foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes exhausted. I asked your disciples to force the spirit out, but they didn’t have the power to do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “You unbelieving generation! How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him to me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the boy to him. As soon as the spirit saw Yeshua, it threw the boy into convulsions. He fell on the ground, rolled around, and foamed at the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked his father, “How long has he been like this?”
The father replied, “He has been this way since he was a child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demon has often thrown him into fire or into water to destroy him. If it’s possible for you, put yourself in our place, and help us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to him, “As far as possibilities go, everything is possible for the person who believes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child’s father cried out at once, “I believe! Help my lack of faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua saw that a crowd was running to the scene, he gave an order to the evil spirit. He said, “You spirit that won’t let him talk, I command you to come out of him and never enter him again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The evil spirit screamed, shook the child violently, and came out. The boy looked as if he were dead, and everyone said, “He’s dead!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua took his hand and helped him to stand up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua went into a house, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we force the spirit out of the boy?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “This kind of spirit can be forced out only by prayer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left that place and were passing through Galilee. Yeshua did not want anyone to know where he was
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was teaching his disciples. He taught them, “The Son of Man will be betrayed and handed over to people. They will kill him, but on the third day he will come back to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples didn’t understand what he meant and were afraid to ask him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Capernaum. While Yeshua was at home, he asked the disciples, “What were you arguing about on the road?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were silent. On the road they had argued about who was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sat down and called the twelve apostles. He told them, “Whoever wants to be the most important person must take the last place and be a servant to everyone else.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a little child and had him stand among them. He put his arms around the child and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever welcomes a child like this in my name welcomes me. Whoever welcomes me welcomes not me but the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said to Yeshua, “Teacher, we saw someone forcing demons out of a person by using the power and authority of your name. We tried to stop him because he was not one of us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said, “Don’t stop him! No one who works a miracle in my name can turn around and speak evil of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever isn’t against us is for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Whoever gives you a cup of water to drink because you belong to Christ will certainly not lose his reward.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These little ones believe in me. It would be best for the person who causes one of them to lose faith to be thrown into the sea with a large stone hung around his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So if your hand causes you to lose your faith, cut it off! It is better for you to enter life disabled than to have two hands and go to hell, to the fire that cannot be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your foot causes you to lose your faith, cut it off! It is better for you to enter life lame than to have two feet and be thrown into hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your eye causes you to lose your faith, tear it out! It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In hell worms that eat the body never die, and the fire is never put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone will be salted with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt is good. But if salt loses its taste, how will you restore its flavor? Have salt within you, and live in peace with one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua left there and went into the territory of Judea along the other side of the Jordan River. Crowds gathered around him again, and he taught them as he usually did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees came to test him. They asked, “Can a husband divorce his wife?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered them, “What command did Moses give you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Moses allowed a man to give his wife a written notice to divorce her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “He wrote this command for you because you’re heartless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God made them male and female in the beginning, at creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why a man will leave his father and mother and will remain united with his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two will be one. So they are no longer two but one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, don’t let anyone separate what God has joined together.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were in a house, the disciples asked him about this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another woman is committing adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a wife divorces her husband and marries another man, she is committing adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people brought little children to Yeshua to have him hold them. But the disciples told the people not to do that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua saw this, he became irritated. He told them, “Don’t stop the children from coming to me. Children like these are part of the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Whoever doesn’t receive the kingdom of God as a little child receives it will never enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua put his arms around the children and blessed them by placing his hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Yeshua was coming out to the road, a man came running to him and knelt in front of him. He asked Yeshua, “Good Teacher, what should I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: Never murder. Never commit adultery. Never steal. Never give false testimony. Never cheat. Honor your father and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man replied, “Teacher, I’ve obeyed all these commandments since I was a boy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua looked at him and loved him. He told him, “You’re still missing one thing. Sell everything you have. Give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the man heard that, he looked unhappy and went away sad, because he owned a lot of property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua looked around and said to his disciples, “How hard it will be for rich people to enter the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were stunned by his words. But Yeshua said to them again, “Children, how hard it is to enter the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This amazed his disciples more than ever. They asked each other, “Who, then, can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua looked at them and said, “It’s impossible for people to save themselves, but it’s not impossible for God to save them. Everything is possible for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter spoke up, “We’ve given up everything to follow you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said, “I can guarantee this truth: Anyone who gave up his home, brothers, sisters, mother, father, children, or fields because of me and the Good News
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: will certainly receive a hundred times as much here in this life. They will certainly receive homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children and fields, along with persecutions. But in the world to come they will receive eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last, and the last will be first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua and his disciples were on their way to Jerusalem. Yeshua was walking ahead of them. His disciples were shocked that he was going to Jerusalem. The others who followed were afraid. Once again he took the twelve apostles aside. He began to tell them what was going to happen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We’re going to Jerusalem. There the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and the experts in Moses’ Teachings. They will condemn him to death and hand him over to foreigners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will make fun of him, spit on him, whip him, and kill him. But after three days he will come back to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and John, sons of Zebedee, went to Yeshua. They said to him, “Teacher, we want you to do us a favor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you want me to do for you?” he asked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Let one of us sit at your right and the other at your left in your glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said, “You don’t realize what you’re asking. Can you drink the cup that I’m going to drink? Can you be baptized with the baptism that I’m going to receive?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“We can,” they told him.
Yeshua told them, “You will drink the cup that I’m going to drink. You will be baptized with the baptism that I’m going to receive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I don’t have the authority to grant you a seat at my right or left. Those positions have already been prepared for certain people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the other ten apostles heard about it, they were irritated with James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua called the apostles and said, “You know that the acknowledged rulers of nations have absolute power over people and their officials have absolute authority over people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that’s not the way it’s going to be among you. Whoever wants to become great among you will be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever wants to be most important among you will be a slave for everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s the same way with the Son of Man. He didn’t come so that others could serve him. He came to serve and to give his life as a ransom for many people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Jericho. As Yeshua, his disciples, and many people were leaving Jericho, a blind beggar named Bartimaeus, son of Timaeus, was sitting by the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that Yeshua from Nazareth was passing by, he began to shout, “Yeshua, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people told him to be quiet. But he shouted even louder, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua stopped and said, “Call him!” They called the blind man and told him, “Cheer up! Get up! He’s calling you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blind man threw off his coat, jumped up, and went to Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked him, “What do you want me to do for you?”
The blind man said, “Teacher, I want to see again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua told him, “Go, your faith has made you well.”
At once he could see again, and he followed Yeshua on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came near Jerusalem, to Bethphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, Yeshua sent two of his disciples ahead of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go into the village ahead of you. As you enter it, you will find a young donkey tied there. No one has ever sat on it. Untie it, and bring it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you what you are doing, say that the Lord needs it. That person will send it here at once.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples found the young donkey in the street. It was tied to the door of a house. As they were untying it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: some men standing there asked them, “Why are you untying that donkey?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples answered them as Yeshua had told them. So the men let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the donkey to Yeshua, put their coats on it, and he sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many spread their coats on the road. Others cut leafy branches in the fields and spread them on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who went ahead and those who followed him were shouting,
“Hosanna!
    Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is our ancestor David’s kingdom that is coming!
    Hosanna in the highest heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua came into Jerusalem and went into the temple courtyard, where he looked around at everything. Since it was already late, he went out with the twelve apostles to Bethany.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when they left Bethany, Yeshua became hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the distance he saw a fig tree with leaves. He went to see if he could find any figs on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves because it wasn’t the season for figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the tree, “No one will ever eat fruit from you again!” His disciples heard this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Jerusalem, Yeshua went into the temple courtyard and began to throw out those who were buying and selling there. He overturned the moneychangers’ tables and the chairs of those who sold pigeons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He would not let anyone carry anything across the temple courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he taught them by saying, “Scripture says, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations,’ but you have turned it into a gathering place for thieves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the chief priests and the experts in Moses’ Teachings heard him, they looked for a way to kill him. They were afraid of him because he amazed all the crowds with his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Every evening Yeshua and his disciples would leave the city.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Yeshua and his disciples were walking early in the morning, they saw that the fig tree had dried up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter remembered what Yeshua had said, so he said to Yeshua, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has dried up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “Have faith in God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: This is what will be done for someone who doesn’t doubt but believes what he says will happen: He can say to this mountain, ‘Be uprooted and thrown into the sea,’ and it will be done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why I tell you to have faith that you have already received whatever you pray for, and it will be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you pray, forgive anything you have against anyone. Then your Father in heaven will forgive your failures.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua and his disciples returned to Jerusalem. As he was walking in the temple courtyard, the chief priests, the experts in Moses’ Teachings, and the leaders came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “What gives you the right to do these things? Who told you that you could do this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “I’ll ask you a question. Answer me, and then I’ll tell you why I have the right to do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did John’s right to baptize come from heaven or from humans? Answer me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They discussed this among themselves. They said, “If we say, ‘from heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘from humans,’ then what will happen?” They were afraid of the people. All the people thought of John as a true prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they answered Yeshua, “We don’t know.”
Yeshua told them, “Then I won’t tell you why I have the right to do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, using this illustration, Yeshua spoke to them. He said, “A man planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, made a vat for the winepress, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to vineyard workers and went on a trip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At the right time he sent a servant to the workers to collect from them a share of the grapes from the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The workers took the servant, beat him, and sent him back with nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man sent another servant to them. They hit the servant on the head and treated him shamefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man sent another, and they killed that servant. Then he sent many other servants. Some of these they beat, and others they killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He had one more person to send. That person was his son, whom he loved. Finally, he sent his son to them. He thought, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But those workers said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took him, killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the workers and give the vineyard to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you never read the Scripture passage:
‘The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has done this,
    and it is amazing for us to see’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They wanted to arrest him but were afraid of the crowd. They knew that he had directed this illustration at them. So they left him alone and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders sent some of the Pharisees and some of Herod’s followers to Yeshua. They wanted to trap him into saying the wrong thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to him, they said, “Teacher, we know that you tell the truth. You don’t favor individuals because of who they are. Rather, you teach the way of God truthfully. Is it right to pay taxes to the emperor or not? Should we pay taxes or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua recognized their hypocrisy, so he asked them, “Why do you test me? Bring me a coin so that I can look at it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They brought a coin. He said to them, “Whose face and name is this?”
They told him, “The emperor’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua said to them, “Give the emperor what belongs to the emperor, and give God what belongs to God.”
They were surprised at his reply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Sadducees, who say that people will never come back to life, came to Yeshua. They asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us, ‘If a man dies and leaves a wife but no child, his brother should marry his widow and have children for his brother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven brothers. The first got married and died without having children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second married her and died without having children. So did the third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the seven brothers had any children. Last of all, the woman died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the dead come back to life, whose wife will she be? The seven brothers had married her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “Aren’t you mistaken because you don’t know the Scriptures or God’s power?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the dead come back to life, they don’t marry. Rather, they are like the angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Haven’t you read in the book of Moses that the dead come back to life? It’s in the passage about the bush, where God said, ‘I am the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He’s not the God of the dead but of the living. You’re badly mistaken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the experts in Moses’ Teachings went to Yeshua during the argument with the Sadducees. He saw how well Yeshua answered them, so he asked him, “Which commandment is the most important of them all?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered, “The most important is, ‘Listen, Israel, the Lord our God is the only Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second most important commandment is this: ‘Love your neighbor as you love yourself.’ No other commandment is greater than these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The expert in Moses’ Teachings said to Yeshua, “Teacher, that was well said! You’ve told the truth that there is only one God and no other besides him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To love him with all your heart, with all your understanding, with all your strength, and to love your neighbor as you love yourself is more important than all the burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Yeshua heard how wisely the man answered, he told the man, “You’re not too far from the kingdom of God.”
After that, no one dared to ask him another question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Yeshua was teaching in the temple courtyard, he asked, “How can the experts in Moses’ Teachings say that the Messiah is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David, guided by the Holy Spirit, said,
‘The Lord said to my Lord:
    “Take the highest position in heaven
        until I put your enemies under your control.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David calls him Lord. So how can he be his son?”
The large crowd enjoyed listening to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he taught, he said, “Watch out for the experts in Moses’ Teachings! They like to walk around in long robes, to be greeted in the marketplaces,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to have the front seats in synagogues and the places of honor at dinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rob widows by taking their houses and then say long prayers to make themselves look good. The experts in Moses’ Teachings will receive the most severe punishment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Yeshua sat facing the temple offering box, he watched how much money people put into it. Many rich people put in large amounts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A poor widow dropped in two small coins, worth less than a cent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called his disciples and said to them, “I can guarantee this truth: This poor widow has given more than all the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them have given what they could spare. But she, in her poverty, has given everything she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Yeshua was going out of the temple courtyard, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, look at these huge stones and these beautiful buildings!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to him, “Do you see these large buildings? Not one of these stones will be left on top of another. Each one will be torn down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Yeshua was sitting on the Mount of Olives facing the temple buildings, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell us, when will this happen? What will be the sign when all this will come to an end?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered them, “Be careful not to let anyone deceive you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many will come using my name. They will say, ‘I am he,’ and they will deceive many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don’t be alarmed! These things must happen, but they don’t mean that the end has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nation will fight against nation and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes and famines in various places. These are only the beginning pains of the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be on your guard! People will hand you over to the Jewish courts and whip you in their synagogues. You will stand in front of governors and kings to testify to them because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first, the Good News must be spread to all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they take you away to hand you over to the authorities, don’t worry ahead of time about what you will say. Instead, say whatever is given to you to say when the time comes. Indeed, you are not the one who will be speaking, but the Holy Spirit will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brother will hand over brother to death; a father will hand over his child. Children will rebel against their parents and kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone will hate you because you are committed to me. But the person who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you see the disgusting thing that will cause destruction standing where it should not (let the reader take note), those of you in Judea should flee to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are on the roof should not come down to get anything out of their houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are in the field should not turn back to get their coats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for the women who are pregnant or who are nursing babies in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that it will not be in winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be a time of misery that has not happened from the beginning of God’s creation until now, and will certainly never happen again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the Lord does not reduce that time, no one will be saved. But those days will be reduced because of those whom God has chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time don’t believe anyone who tells you, ‘Here is the Messiah!’ or ‘There he is!’
verses.speaker: Narrator
