verses.text: False messiahs and false prophets will appear. They will work miraculous signs and do wonderful things to deceive, if possible, those whom God has chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on your guard! I have told you everything before it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, after the misery of those days, the sun will turn dark, the moon will not give light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the universe will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then people will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will send out his angels, and from every direction under the sky, they will gather those whom God has chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Learn from the story of the fig tree. When its branch becomes tender and it sprouts leaves, you know summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, when you see these things happen, you know that he is near, at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee this truth: This generation will not disappear until all these things take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth and the heavens will disappear, but my words will never disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one knows when that day or hour will come. Even the angels in heaven and the Son don’t know. Only the Father knows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful! Watch! You don’t know the exact time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a man who went on a trip. As he left home, he put his servants in charge. He assigned work to each one and ordered the guard to be alert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, be alert, because you don’t know when the owner of the house will return. It could be in the evening or at midnight or at dawn or in the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make sure he doesn’t come suddenly and find you asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m telling everyone what I’m telling you: ‘Be alert!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was two days before the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread. The chief priests and the experts in Moses’ Teachings were looking for some underhanded way to arrest Yeshua and to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, they said, “We shouldn’t arrest him during the festival, or else there will be a riot among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua was in Bethany at the home of Simon, a man who had suffered from a skin disease. While Yeshua was sitting there, a woman went to him. She had a bottle of very expensive perfume made from pure nard. She opened the bottle and poured the perfume on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some who were there were irritated and said to one another, “Why was the perfume wasted like this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This perfume could have been sold for a high price, and the money could have been given to the poor.” So they said some very unkind things to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said, “Leave her alone! Why are you bothering her? She has done a beautiful thing for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will always have the poor with you and can help them whenever you want. But you will not always have me with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She did what she could. She came to pour perfume on my body before it is placed in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Wherever the Good News is spoken in the world, what she has done will also be told in memory of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve apostles, went to the chief priests to betray Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were pleased to hear what Judas had to say and promised to give him money. So he kept looking for a chance to betray Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Killing the Passover lamb was customary on the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread. The disciples asked Yeshua, “Where do you want us to prepare the Passover meal for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent two of his disciples and told them, “Go into the city. You will meet a man carrying a jug of water. Follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he goes into a house, tell the owner that the teacher asks, ‘Where is my room where I can eat the Passover meal with my disciples?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take you upstairs and show you a large room. The room will be completely furnished. Get everything ready for us there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples left. They went into the city and found everything as Yeshua had told them. So they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, Yeshua arrived with the twelve apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were at the table eating, Yeshua said, “I can guarantee this truth: One of you is going to betray me, one who is eating with me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Feeling hurt, they asked him one by one, “You don’t mean me, do you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “It’s one of you twelve, someone dipping his hand into the bowl with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man is going to die as the Scriptures say he will. But how horrible it will be for that person who betrays the Son of Man! It would have been better for that person if he had never been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were eating, Yeshua took bread and blessed it. He broke the bread, gave it to them, and said, “Take this. This is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a cup, spoke a prayer of thanksgiving, and gave the cup to them. They all drank from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This is my blood, the blood of the promise. It is poured out for many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee this truth: I won’t drink this wine again until that day when I drink new wine in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they sang a hymn, they went to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Yeshua said to them, “All of you will abandon me. Scripture says,
‘I will strike the shepherd,
    and the sheep will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But after I am brought back to life, I will go to Galilee ahead of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Even if everyone else abandons you, I won’t.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to Peter, “I can guarantee this truth: Tonight, before a rooster crows twice, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said very strongly, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never say that I don’t know you.” All the other disciples said the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to a place called Gethsemane. He said to his disciples, “Stay here while I pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Peter, James, and John with him and began to feel distressed and anguished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “My anguish is so great that I feel as if I’m dying. Wait here, and stay awake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After walking a little farther, he fell to the ground and prayed that if it were possible he might not have to suffer what was ahead of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Abba! Father! You can do anything. Take this cup of suffering away from me. But let your will be done rather than mine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went back and found them asleep. He said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you stay awake for one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay awake, and pray that you won’t be tempted. You want to do what’s right, but you’re weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away again and prayed the same prayer as before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He found them asleep because they couldn’t keep their eyes open. They didn’t even know what they should say to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came back a third time and said to them, “You might as well sleep now. It’s all over. The time has come for the Son of Man to be handed over to sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up! Let’s go! The one who is betraying me is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then, while Yeshua was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve apostles, arrived. A crowd carrying swords and clubs was with him. They were from the chief priests, the experts in Moses’ Teachings, and the leaders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, the traitor had given them a signal. He said, “The one I kiss is the man you want. Arrest him, and guard him closely as you take him away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas quickly stepped up to Yeshua and said, “Rabbi!” and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some men took hold of Yeshua and arrested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of those standing there pulled out his sword and cut off the ear of the chief priest’s servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua asked them, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest me as if I were a criminal?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I used to teach in the temple courtyard every day. But you didn’t arrest me then. But what the Scriptures say must come true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the disciples abandoned him and ran away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain young man was following Yeshua. He had nothing on but a linen sheet. They tried to arrest him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he left the linen sheet behind and ran away naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men took Yeshua to the chief priest. All the chief priests, the leaders, and the experts in Moses’ Teachings had gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter followed him at a distance and went into the chief priest’s courtyard. He sat with the guards and warmed himself facing the glow of a fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the whole Jewish council were searching for some testimony against Yeshua in order to execute him. But they couldn’t find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many gave false testimony against him, but their statements did not agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some men stood up and gave false testimony against him. They said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We heard him say, ‘I’ll tear down this temple made by humans, and in three days I’ll build another temple, one not made by human hands.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their testimony did not agree even on this point.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the chief priest stood up in the center and asked Yeshua, “Don’t you have any answer to what these men testify against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he was silent.
The chief priest asked him again, “Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered, “Yes, I am, and you will see the Son of Man in the highest position in heaven. He will be coming with the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priest tore his clothes in horror and said, “Why do we need any more witnesses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You’ve heard him dishonor God! What’s your verdict?”
All of them condemned him with the death sentence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them began to spit on him. They covered his face and hit him with their fists. They said to him, “Prophesy!” Even the guards took him and slapped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter was in the courtyard. One of the chief priest’s female servants
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saw Peter warming himself. She looked at him and said, “You, too, were with Yeshua from Nazareth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Peter denied it by saying, “I don’t know him, and I don’t understand what you’re talking about.”
He went to the entrance. Then a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant saw him. Once again she said to those who were standing around, “This man is one of them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter again denied it.
After a little while the men standing there said to Peter again, “It’s obvious you’re one of them. You’re a Galilean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to curse and swear with an oath, “I don’t know this man you’re talking about!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then a rooster crowed a second time. Peter remembered that Yeshua said to him, “Before a rooster crows twice, you will say three times that you don’t know me.” Then Peter began to cry very hard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning the chief priests immediately came to a decision with the leaders and the experts in Moses’ Teachings. The whole Jewish council decided to tie Yeshua up, lead him away, and hand him over to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
“Yes, I am,” Yeshua answered him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests were accusing him of many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate asked him again, “Don’t you have any answer? Look how many accusations they’re bringing against you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yeshua no longer answered anything, so Pilate was surprised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At every Passover festival, Pilate would free one prisoner whom the people asked for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man named Barabbas in prison. He was with some rebels who had committed murder during a riot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd asked Pilate to do for them what he always did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered them, “Do you want me to free the king of the Jews for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate knew that the chief priests had handed Yeshua over to him because they were jealous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests stirred up the crowd so that Pilate would free Barabbas for them instead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate again asked them, “Then what should I do with the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Crucify him!” they shouted back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate said to them, “Why? What has he done wrong?”
But they shouted even louder, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate wanted to satisfy the people, so he freed Barabbas for them. But he had Yeshua whipped and handed over to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers led Yeshua into the courtyard of the palace and called together the whole troop.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They dressed him in purple, twisted some thorns into a crown, and placed it on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they began to greet him, “Long live the king of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept hitting him on the head with a stick, spitting on him, and kneeling in front of him with false humility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the soldiers finished making fun of Yeshua, they took off the purple cape and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him out to crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Simon from the city of Cyrene was coming into Jerusalem from his home in the country. He was the father of Alexander and Rufus. As he was about to pass by, the soldiers forced him to carry Yeshua’s cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took Yeshua to Golgotha (which means “the place of the skull”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tried to give him wine mixed with a drug called myrrh, but he wouldn’t take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next they crucified him. Then they divided his clothes among themselves by throwing dice to see what each one would get.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was nine in the morning when they crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a written notice of the accusation against him. It read, “The king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They crucified two criminals with him, one on his right and the other on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who passed by insulted him. They shook their heads and said, “What a joke! You were going to tear down God’s temple and build it again in three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come down from the cross, and save yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the experts in Moses’ Teachings made fun of him among themselves in the same way. They said, “He saved others, but he can’t save himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the Messiah, the king of Israel, come down from the cross now so that we may see and believe.” Even those who were crucified with him were insulting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At noon darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At three o’clock Yeshua cried out in a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When some of the people standing there heard him say that, they said, “Listen! He’s calling Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone ran and soaked a sponge in vinegar. Then he put it on a stick and offered Yeshua a drink. The man said, “Let’s see if Elijah comes to take him down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua cried out in a loud voice and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The curtain in the temple was split in two from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the officer who stood facing Yeshua saw how he gave up his spirit, he said, “Certainly, this man was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some women were watching from a distance. Among them were Mary from Magdala, Mary (the mother of young James and Joseph), and Salome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had followed him and supported him while he was in Galilee. Many other women who had come to Jerusalem with him were there too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was Friday evening, before the day of worship,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when Joseph arrived. He was from the city of Arimathea and was an important member of the Jewish council. He, too, was waiting for the kingdom of God. Joseph boldly went to Pilate’s quarters to ask for the body of Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate wondered if Yeshua had already died. So he summoned the officer to ask him if Yeshua was, in fact, dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the officer had assured him that Yeshua was dead, Pilate let Joseph have the corpse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph had purchased some linen cloth. He took the body down from the cross and wrapped it in the cloth. Then he laid the body in a tomb, which had been cut out of rock, and he rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary from Magdala and Mary (the mother of Joses) watched where Yeshua was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the day of worship was over, Mary from Magdala, Mary (the mother of James), and Salome bought spices to go and anoint Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On Sunday they were going to the tomb very early when the sun had just come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to one another, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance to the tomb?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they looked up, they saw that the stone had been rolled away. It was a very large stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went into the tomb, they saw a young man. He was dressed in a white robe and sat on the right side. They were panic-stricken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young man said to them, “Don’t panic! You’re looking for Yeshua from Nazareth, who was crucified. He has been brought back to life. He’s not here. Look at the place where they laid him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and tell his disciples and Peter that he’s going ahead of them to Galilee. There they will see him, just as he told them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out of the tomb and ran away. Shock and trembling had overwhelmed them. They didn’t say a thing to anyone, because they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Yeshua came back to life early on Sunday, he appeared first to Mary from Magdala, from whom he had forced out seven demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went and told his friends, who were grieving and crying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They didn’t believe her when they heard that he was alive and that she had seen him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later Yeshua appeared to two disciples as they were walking to their home in the country. He did not look as he usually did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went back and told the others, who did not believe them either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still later Yeshua appeared to the eleven apostles while they were eating. He put them to shame for their unbelief and because they were too stubborn to believe those who had seen him alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said to them, “So wherever you go in the world, tell everyone the Good News.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the miraculous signs that will accompany believers: They will use the power and authority of my name to force demons out of people. They will speak new languages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will pick up snakes, and if they drink any deadly poison, it will not hurt them. They will place their hands on the sick and cure them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After talking with the apostles, the Lord was taken to heaven, where God gave him the highest position.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples spread the Good News everywhere. The Lord worked with them. He confirmed his word by the miraculous signs that accompanied it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
